item.title: Incorrect reinstatement of red tarmac after resurfacing, 30th December
item.description:
There are three slow markers each reinforced with red tarmac cut into the roadway however when the road was resurfaced there are two distinct drops in the road surface where the road surface ends and the red tarmac begins. You have to slow down to half the posted speed limit to pass these and the road is beginning to break up around them. This has been like this for months.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Not fixed, 30th December
item.description:
Someone kindly reported that the council collect these and marked this as fixed. Two points. 1 - they have not in over a week, so please don't mark this as fixed. 2 - this is still a trip hazard and is blocking the pavement for anyone in a wheelchair or pushing a buggy. 3 - If as suspected these are from the mattress shop please can they place these safely at the front of the shop by their trailer where even if they fall they are not a hazard. Please do not close this report until this is resolved.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woolwich Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet
